channel.title: CNN.com
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: 18 killed in twin Afghan blasts
item.description: Two explosions in the Afghan cities of Kabul and Mazar-e Sharif kill at least 18 people on the Shiite holy day of Ashura, police officials say.

item.title: Merkel, Sarkozy agree on fiscal pact
item.description: Ahead of a key European summit this week, the leaders of France and Germany agree a financial deal for the eurozone. The agreement comes amid the bloc's debt crisis.

item.title: Italian PM presents $41B budget plan
item.description: Italy's new prime minister will present to parliament Monday a proposal for ?30 billion ($41 billion) in new taxes and spending cuts over two years, including reductions to future pensions, in an effort to end a budget crisis that has clouded the future of Europe's common currency.

item.title: Clinton seeks Russia election probe
item.description: Secretary of State Hillary Clinton called for a "full investigation" of irregularities in Sunday's parliamentary elections in which the party of Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin appears to have suffered a serious setback.

item.title: Syria opposition warns Iran, Hezbollah
item.description: Iran and Lebanon's Hezbollah movement are risking their future ties with Syria by supporting Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad now, a Syrian opposition leader says.

item.title: U.N. condemns Mexico shooting
item.description: The United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights in Mexico has denounced the shooting of an activist who survived being shot multiple times in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, by an unknown attacker.

item.title: Japan tsunami saw 'merged' waves
item.description: The devastating wall of water that struck Japan in March was the result of at least two waves that combined to create a more powerful tsunami, U.S. scientists said Monday.

item.title: Broadcaster fined for Jiang death story
item.description: A television station in Hong Kong has been fined for airing a report in July that suggested former Chinese President Jiang Zemin had died, regulators said Tuesday.

item.title: UAE PM discounts fear of Iran
item.description: The leader of the United Arab Emirates discounts concerns about a nuclear-armed Iran in a CNN interview, saying Tehran would find the ultimate weapon of little use.

item.title: France admits nuclear security lapses
item.description: France's interior minister admitted Monday that lapses in security made it possible for Greenpeace activists to gain entry to a nuclear power plant southeast of Paris.
